intro: Neoporteria subgibbosa f. litoralis, commonly known as the coastal neoporteria, is a rare plant species characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its diverse and often ornamental flora. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky coastal areas, where it is exposed to salt spray and strong winds. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually pink or purple, adding to its ornamental value. This subspecies is of particular interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to coastal habitats.
